<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Other Events </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Attached as Exhibit&nbsp;100 to this Current Report
on Form&nbsp;8-K are the following financial statements from the Quarterly Report on Form&nbsp;10-Q of McCormick&nbsp;&amp; Company,&nbsp;Incorporated for the quarter ended May&nbsp;31, 2008, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on
July&nbsp;9, 2008, formatted in XBRL (Extensible Business Reporting Language): (i)&nbsp;the Consolidated Statements of Income for the three- and six-month periods ended May&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007, (ii)&nbsp;the Consolidated Balance Sheet at
May&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007 and November&nbsp;30, 2007, and (iii)&nbsp;the Consolidated Statement of Cash Flows for the six-month periods ended May&nbsp;31, 2008 and 2007. Users of this data are advised pursuant to Rule&nbsp;401 of Regulation S-T
that the financial and other information contained in the XBRL documents is unaudited and that these are not the official publicly filed financial statements of McCormick&nbsp;&amp; Company,&nbsp;Incorporated. The purpose of submitting these XBRL
formatted documents is to test the related format and technology and, as a result, investors should continue to rely on the official filed version of the furnished documents and not rely on the information in this Current Report on Form&nbsp;8-K,
including Exhibit&nbsp;100, in making investment decisions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In accordance with Rule&nbsp;402 of Regulation S-T, the information in this Current Report on
Form&nbsp;8-K, including Exhibit&nbsp;100, shall not be deemed to be &#147;filed&#148; for purposes of Section&nbsp;18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;), or otherwise subject to the liability of that
section, and shall not be incorporated by reference into any registration statement or other document filed under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange Act, except as shall be expressly set forth by specific reference in such
filing. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

    <loc xlink:type="locator" xlink:href="mkc-20080531.xsd#mkc_AdjustmentExtraordinaryItemNetOfTax" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentExtraordinaryItemNetOfTax"/>
    <labelArc xlink:type="arc" xlink:arcrole="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/arcrole/concept-label" xlink:from="mkc_AdjustmentExtraordinaryItemNetOfTax" xlink:to="mkc_AdjustmentExtraordinaryItemNetOfTax_lbl"/>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/documentation" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentExtraordinaryItemNetOfTax_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Gains (losses), after tax, arising from an event or transaction that is both unusual in nature and infrequent in occurrence when considered in relation to the environment in which the entity operates. This amount should be the same as the amount disclosed on the income statement. The effect of an extraordinary event or transaction should be classified separately in the income statement if it is material in relation to income before extraordinary items or to the trend of annual earnings before extraordinary items, or is material by other appropriate criteria. Items should be considered individually and not in the aggregate in determining whether an extraordinary event or transaction is material.</label>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/label" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentExtraordinaryItemNetOfTax_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Extraordinary Item, Net of Tax</label>

    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/documentation" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentGoodwillImpairmentLoss_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Loss recognized during the period that results from the write-down of goodwill after comparing the implied fair value of reporting unit goodwill with the carrying amount of that goodwill. Goodwill is assessed at least annually for impairment.</label>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/label" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentGoodwillImpairmentLoss_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Goodwill, Impairment Loss</label>
    <loc xlink:type="locator" xlink:href="mkc-20080531.xsd#mkc_AdjustmentIncomeFromEquityMethodInvestments" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeFromEquityMethodInvestments"/>
    <labelArc xlink:type="arc" xlink:arcrole="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/arcrole/concept-label" xlink:from="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeFromEquityMethodInvestments" xlink:to="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeFromEquityMethodInvestments_lbl"/>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/documentation" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeFromEquityMethodInvestments_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">This item represents the entity's proportionate share for the period of the undistributed net income of its investee (such as unconsolidated subsidiaries and joint ventures) to which the equity method of accounting is applied. Such amount typically reflects adjustments similar to those made in preparing consolidated statements, including adjustments to eliminate intercompany gains and losses, and to amortize, if appropriate, any difference between cost and underlying equity in net assets of the investee at the date of investment.</label>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/label" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeFromEquityMethodInvestments_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Income from unconsolidated operations</label>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://xbrl.us/us-gaap/role/label/negated" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeFromEquityMethodInvestments_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Income from unconsolidated operations</label>
    <loc xlink:type="locator" xlink:href="mkc-20080531.xsd#mkc_AdjustmentIncomeLossFromDiscontinuedOperationsNetOfTax" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeLossFromDiscontinuedOperationsNetOfTax"/>
    <labelArc xlink:type="arc" xlink:arcrole="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/arcrole/concept-label" xlink:from="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeLossFromDiscontinuedOperationsNetOfTax" xlink:to="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeLossFromDiscontinuedOperationsNetOfTax_lbl"/>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/documentation" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeLossFromDiscontinuedOperationsNetOfTax_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Overall income (loss) from a disposal group that is classified as a component of the entity, net of income tax, reported as a separate component of income before extraordinary items and the cumulative effect of accounting changes. Includes the following (net of tax): income (loss) from operations during the phase-out period, gain (loss) on disposal, provision (or any reversals of earlier provisions) for loss on disposal, and adjustments of a prior period gain (loss) on disposal.</label>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/label" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeLossFromDiscontinuedOperationsNetOfTax_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Income (Loss) from Discontinued Operations, Net of Tax</label>
    <loc xlink:type="locator" xlink:href="mkc-20080531.xsd#mkc_AdjustmentIncomeLossFromEquityMethodInvestments" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeLossFromEquityMethodInvestments"/>
    <labelArc xlink:type="arc" xlink:arcrole="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/arcrole/concept-label" xlink:from="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeLossFromEquityMethodInvestments" xlink:to="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeLossFromEquityMethodInvestments_lbl"/>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/documentation" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeLossFromEquityMethodInvestments_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">This item represents the entity's proportionate share for the period of the undistributed net income (loss) of its investee (such as unconsolidated subsidiaries and joint ventures) to which the equity method of accounting is applied. Such amount typically reflects adjustments similar to those made in preparing consolidated statements, including adjustments to eliminate intercompany gains and losses, and to amortize, if appropriate, any difference between cost and underlying equity in net assets of the investee at the date of investment.</label>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/label" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentIncomeLossFromEquityMethodInvestments_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Income (Loss) from Equity Method Investments</label>

    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/documentation" xlink:label="mkc_AdjustmentLossFromEquityMethodInvestments_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">This item represents the entity's proportionate share for the period of the undistributed net loss of its investee (such as unconsolidated subsidiaries and joint ventures) to which the equity method of accounting is applied. Such amount typically reflects adjustments similar to those made in preparing consolidated statements, including adjustments to eliminate intercompany gains and losses, and to amortize, if appropriate, any difference between cost and underlying equity in net assets of the investee at the date of investment.</label>

    <loc xlink:type="locator" xlink:href="mkc-20080531.xsd#mkc_CashCashEquivalentsBeginningYear" xlink:label="mkc_CashCashEquivalentsBeginningYear"/>
    <labelArc xlink:type="arc" xlink:arcrole="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/arcrole/concept-label" xlink:from="mkc_CashCashEquivalentsBeginningYear" xlink:to="mkc_CashCashEquivalentsBeginningYear_lbl"/>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/documentation" xlink:label="mkc_CashCashEquivalentsBeginningYear_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Cash and cash equivalents at the beginning of the year.  Cash equivalents are short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.  Generally, only investments with original maturities of three months or less qualify under the definition.</label>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/label" xlink:label="mkc_CashCashEquivalentsBeginningYear_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Cash and cash equivalents at beginning of period</label>

Cash equivalents are short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.  Generally, only investments with original maturities of three months or less qualify under the definition.</label>

Additionally, amounts recognized corresponding to adjustments in other comprehensive income when the gains or losses, prior service costs or credits, and transition assets or obligations remaining from the initial application of Statements 87 and 106 are subsequently recognized as components of net periodic benefit cost pursuant to the recognition and amortization provisions of Statements 87, 88, and 106.</label>

    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/documentation" xlink:label="mkc_ChangeRealizedGainLossMarketableSecuritiesNetTaxEffect_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">The change in accumulated realized holding gains and losses on securities available-for-sale, or that result from the transfer of a debt security being transferred from 'hold-to-maturity' category to 'avail-for-sale'. Increases or decreases in the fair value of securities available-for-sale that occur after such securities have been written down as impaired.  Net of tax effect.</label>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/label" xlink:label="mkc_ChangeRealizedGainLossMarketableSecuritiesNetTaxEffect_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Increase/(Decrease) in Realized Gain/(Loss) on Marketable Securities, Net of Reclassifications, Net of Tax Effect</label>

    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/documentation" xlink:label="mkc_IncomeFromEquityMethodInvestments_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">This item represents the entity's proportionate share for the period of the undistributed net income of its investee (such as unconsolidated subsidiaries and joint ventures) to which the equity method of accounting is applied. Such amount typically reflects adjustments similar to those made in preparing consolidated statements, including adjustments to eliminate intercompany gains and losses, and to amortize, if appropriate, any difference between cost and underlying equity in net assets of the investee at the date of investment.</label>

    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/documentation" xlink:label="mkc_LossFromEquityMethodInvestments_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">This item represents the entity's proportionate share for the period of the undistributed net loss of its investee (such as unconsolidated subsidiaries and joint ventures) to which the equity method of accounting is applied. Such amount typically reflects adjustments similar to those made in preparing consolidated statements, including adjustments to eliminate intercompany gains and losses, and to amortize, if appropriate, any difference between cost and underlying equity in net assets of the investee at the date of investment.</label>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/label" xlink:label="mkc_LossFromEquityMethodInvestments_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Loss on sale of unconsolidated operations</label>
    <label xlink:type="resource" xlink:role="http://xbrl.us/us-gaap/role/label/negated" xlink:label="mkc_LossFromEquityMethodInvestments_lbl" xml:lang="en-US">Loss on sale of unconsolidated operations</label>
